hesml.taxonomy.impl

Class Taxonomy

  • java.lang.Object
    • hesml.taxonomy.impl.Taxonomy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ITaxonomy

    class Taxonomy
extends java.lang.Object
implements ITaxonomy
    This class implements the ITaxonomy interface which represents an abstract taxonomy based on a half-edge representation as detailed in the paper below. Lastra-Díaz, J. J., and García-Serrano, A. (2016). HESML: a scalable ontology-based semantic similarity measures library with a set of reproducible experiments and a replication dataset. To appear in the Information Systems Journal.
    Author:
    Juan Lastra-Díaz

      Collection of non-oriented edges of the taxonomy
      private VertexList m_Vertexes
      Full indexed collection of the vertexes within the taxonomy.

      • getLCS

        public IVertex getLCS(IVertex begin,
                      IVertex end,
                      boolean useLongestDepth)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        This function computes the lowest common subsumer (ancestor), defined as the common ancestor with highest depth. The function returns the first vertex in the LCA set, although could exist more than one on multiple inheritance taxonomies. As the node depth is defined in two different ways, the last parameter defines what depth is used to recover the LCS vertex.
        Specified by:
        getLCS in interface ITaxonomy
        Parameters:
        begin -
        end -
        useLongestDepth - Use the softest ascending path depth attribute (false) or the depth attribute defined as the longest ascending path to the root.
        Returns:
        LCS vertex
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - There is no any common subsumer

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Remove all the objects and destroys the taxonomy.
        Specified by:
        clear in interface ITaxonomy

      • getMICA

        public IVertex getMICA(IVertex begin,
                       IVertex end)
                throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                       java.lang.Exception
        This function returns the most informative common ancestor (MICA) vertex. The method marks all the ancestor vertexes from both input vertexes, then it looks for the intersection set which is defined as the marked vertexes in both ancestor sets.
        Specified by:
        getMICA in interface ITaxonomy
        Parameters:
        begin - First input vertex
        end - Second input vertex
        Returns:
        The most informative common ancestor (MICA) vertex.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - A MICA vertex was not found
        java.lang.Exception

      • getUnorderedAncestorSet

        private java.util.HashSet<IVertex> getUnorderedAncestorSet(IVertex seed)
                                                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This function retrieves the ancestor set of the seed vertex, including this later one, and returns the set as an unordered HashSet, instead of the heavier and ordered IVertexList.
        Parameters:
        seed - Seed vertex whose ancestors set will be visited.
        Returns:
        The ancestor set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • computeHyponymCount

        private void computeHyponymCount()
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        This function forces the computation and caching of the hyponym set count for each concept in the taxonomy. It is made to accelerate the computation of several IC models using the Hyponym count feature.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computesCachedAttributes

        public void computesCachedAttributes()
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        This function forces the computation of several taxonomical features required by IC models and ontology-based similarity measures. All the cached features correspond to integer values as the node depths, and cardinals of sets as the leaves count and hyponym count. The taxonomy does not store any cache of object collections which are always computed on-the-fly through the adjacency relationships encoded by using the posetHERep adjacency model. This function is especially helpful for the speedup of cross-validation benchmarks of similarity measures and IC models.
        Specified by:
        computesCachedAttributes in interface ITaxonomy
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeAllDepths

        private void computeAllDepths()
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        This function computes the minimum and maximum depth for all vertexes within the taxonomy. The minimum depth is measured as the shortest ascending path from the vertex to the root, whilst the maximum depth is defined as the length of the longest ascending path from the vertex to the root.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeLeavesCount

        private void computeLeavesCount()
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        This function forces the computation and caching of the leaves set count for each concept in the taxonomy. It is made to accelerate the computation of several IC models using the leaves count feature.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addVertex

        public IVertex addVertex(java.lang.Integer vertexId,
                         java.lang.Integer[] parentVertexes)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        This function inserts a novel vertex in the graph by connecting it to its parents. We note that the parent vertexes must be already present within the taxonomy before the creation and insertion of a new vertex.
        Specified by:
        addVertex in interface ITaxonomy
        Parameters:
        vertexId - Integer unique key of the new vertex.
        parentVertexes - Integer IDs of the parent vertexes.
        Returns:
        The new vertex inserted into the taxonomy
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - The vertexID already exists in the taxonomy, or any parent ID does not match any existent vertex

      • getVertexes

        public IVertexList getVertexes()
        This function returns the global collection of vertexes contained in the taxonomy.
        Specified by:
        getVertexes in interface ITaxonomy
        Returns:
        Concepts in the taxonomy

      • getEdges

        public IEdgeList getEdges()
        This function returns the global collection of non-oriented edges contained in the taxonomy.
        Specified by:
        getEdges in interface ITaxonomy
        Returns:
        Edges of the concepts in the taxonomy
